result.execSummary:
The defendant James Douglas Carlson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order for payment of Atty. David Zarwell as appointed defense counsel in the amount of $2673.70 covering cases 15CT370, 15CF216, 15CF122 ( Fees assessed to case 15CT370) .

It is hereby ordered that:  The Defendant is liable for acourt appointed attorney fees.  The Defendant shall pay said attorney fees as part of the payment plan in case 15CT370.  Failure to pay fees will result in:  Jail sentence of 53 days c/s and Entry of civil judgment.
with attachments and proposed order for payment of court appointed defense counsel fees from Attorney David Zarwell in the amount of $2673.70 .
COC Please issue an amended JOC as requested ( 2 years Probation Cts 3 & 5)
from DOC requesting clarification of the probationary terms ordered in Counts 3 & 5

Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV

Cases 15CF122, 15CF216, 15CT370 called together at 3:34pm [mo]
Defendant James Douglas Carlson in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CT370:
On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant: 

--To serve   4 months  in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence FORTHWITH
--To pay fine of $1000+ costs= $2304.74(incl. $56.74 in blood testing fees), to be paid in $100 per month installments, commencing on  6/1/16 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in 10 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive
--Revocation of drivers license for 18 months
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment 
--Jefferson County Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 18 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed


As to Case 15CF122, Counts #1, #3, and #5
The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 4 years, with conditions:
--On Case 15CF122, Count #1: to serve 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CT370

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo assessment, treatment or  counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to maintain employment
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars or taverns
--to provide DNA sample
--to pay statutory costs

Case 15CF216, Count #1:
The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 4 years, with conditions as ordered in case 15CF122, with the exception of the jail. 

15CT370: Days credit for time already served:  0  days
15CF122: Days credit for time already served:  1  days
15CF216: Days credit for time already served:  11  days 
recess: 3:54pm
submitted by Atty. Zarwell on behalf of Defendant
Sentencing hearing on April 29, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] cases 15CF216, 15CT370 & 15CF122 called at 8:56am. 
Defendant James D Carlson in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
These cases are scheduled for Sentencing Hearing today, however the Defense has filed a Motion for Continuance, requesting a short adjournment to raise funds that will allow Mr. Carlson to have Huber release.  
The Court adjourns the hearing for one week.  
The Court emphasizes to Mr. Carlson that all conditions of Bond remain in effect over the next week.  The Court indicates to Mr. Carlson that he should plan to commence his jail term at the conclusion of next week's hearing.
recess 9:01am.

NEXT:  rescheduled Sentencing on all three cases, on Friday 4/29/16 at 3:30pm.
for Continuance of the 4-22-2016 Sentencing Hearing - Defendant's
Sentencing hearing on April 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.
with Attachment, Elements and JIs attached

Cases 15CF216, 15CT370 & 15CF122 called together at 2:09 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant James Douglas Carlson in court with Attorney David Zarwell. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CT370: Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 & #3

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1-15CF216 & Counts #1, #3 & #5-15CF122; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining Counts in Cases 15CF216 & 15CF122

Atty Zarwell requests sentencing be set out to April 22, 2016 so Mr. Carlson can get some additional monies together for Huber fees prior to serving any imposed jail sentence
DA Happ informs the Court that although this date is a little further out than ADA Shock had anticipated, the State would not object as did speak with Atty Zarwell prior to hearing and he did indicate that Mr. Carlson would be prepared to report forthwith following the sentencing hearing.
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that Mr. Carlson does plan on reporting forthwith, that is why defense is requesting a Friday sentencing date
Court reminds Mr. Carlson that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while the case is pending. Court also informs Mr. Carlson that he should plan on reporting forthwith for jail sentence following sentencing hearing, as that is one of the main reasons the Court has agreed to postpone the sentencing.
Recess: 2:23 pm

NEXT: ALL CASES (1) Schedule Sentencing Hearing 4/22/16 at 9:00 am - Send notices

Cases 15CF122, 15CF216 and 15CT370 called together at 1:37pm [mo]

Atty. Zarwell indicates that this case will likely end in resolution
The Court schedules 15CF122 for FSSC and Jury Trial; 15CF216 and 15CT370 are to follow as STC.

Cases 15CF122 & 15CF216 called together at 11:05 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant James D Carlson in court with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zarwell: Mr. Carlson currently has 3 open cases - have received an offer on all 3 cases. No attorney has been appointed on the 3rd case and are still awaiting some discovery. Requests that these cases be set with other pending matter in October so matters can track and possibly be resolved together.

Court now calls case 15CT370: 11:06 am

ADA Hall has no objection to setting these cases along with STC in case 15CT370
